column5: Hey folks.  I had a busy week of college and was looking very forward to getting downtown and trying to get a King to play. Got downtown just before dusk and washed some glow cleos.  Decided to go to a crankbait to rattle an annoyance bite. I went to pull out a pearl bomber long A, but my firetiger HJ got all jumbled up with it, so I put it on instead thinking, yeah I've done good with Husky Jerks on salmon.  Sure enough 10 casts later, massive slam and I got into a good salmon, he made 4 or 5 really nice long runs. Thankfully two high school aged kids saw me fighting it and watched, so I asked one of them to take a picture for me.    I was quite happy to have got to catch this fish after thinking about it and daydreaming about fishing all week.  I got him on my little bench I use to remove the hook and got another quick picture.    Then, I wished him good luck spawning and sent him on his way, he revived very quickly and thrashed away!      I was considering staying around and throwing some slashbaits for walleye but I opted to rent a movie and wait for my girlfriend to get home for some victory activities, caveman style. My next target, a st. mary's brown trout! wish me luck.  Tight Lines!
Great job man, I got baits like that. Should give something a try next weekend if there open at the Oshawa Harbor.  Thanks for sharing, MTBF
I hear King milk makes great lube..  Dirt Mcgirt dude!!

Sweet reward for that split decision in choosing your favorite lure Got to love that.... and congratulations on this beauty king Good luck on your hunt for them browns!!! Great job Kinger and thanks for sharing Leechman
Nice fish... but alas... you won't see this till morning, or after the caveman activities...  you "hunter gatherer he man you "

nice king man!  lol so im not the only one who dreams and day dreams about fishing eh? you in the rapids or?? anyhow good luck on that brown! i've heard their not the easiest to catch down there.    JP

AHAHA, I'll see what she thinks of that idea. LOL.  Thanks for the kind words. I'm buying my first spool of expensive ass florocarbon and a noodle rod as I turn my attention to brown trout...ahhh I can't wait.
No need to run expensive flouro to catch brownies   If anything just use the leader material as your tippet.
Yeah, I was thinking of going 10 lb. Maxima Ultragreen as my main line with a long floro leader.
is fluro needed or can i catch steelhead on 10 lb line?
not for me it isnt.... i catch them while im jigging for whitefish with 10lb berkley trilene

Not needed at all..   Now if you are fishing gin clear water, you'll most likely have more hookups if you are running a flouro leader, but I know guys that never use it regardless of water clarity..  They make out ok

lemme know if you get a brown kinger... i caught one back in the late 80's (maybe 8 inches) and haven't seen one since. i know they were stocked years ago, but i never see/hear anything about them anymore.

Luc, I got one out of the cdn hole in Feb of 2008, on the south side where the us current meets the pool. No pics as it was ridiculously cold out. Was maybe 5lbs. On an olive jig.  Rumor has it they are a little easier to catch after dark, but good luck with wading the raps at night.   No it wasnt an atlantic either.....
Oh great, I'm hearing more and more that its next to impossible to get a brown during the day down there.  Maybe I will have to search for one north or northwest of here.
i think the rapids would be the place kinger.  get yourself a set of waders and we'll go out floating.
